summary.long: John is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The same was in the beginning with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All things were made by Him, and without Him was not anything made that was made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Him was life, and that life was the Light of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Light shineth in darkness, and the darkness comprehended it not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a man sent from God, whose name was John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The same came as a witness to bear witness of the Light, that all men through him might believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was not that Light, but was sent to bear witness of that Light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That was the true Light which lighteth every man that cometh into the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was in the world, and the world was made by Him, and the world knew Him not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came unto His own, and His own received Him not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as many as received Him, to them gave He power to become the sons of God, even to those who believe in His name,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who were born not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Word was made flesh, and dwelt among us (and we beheld His glory, the glory as of the only Begotten of the Father), full of grace and truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John bore witness of Him and cried, saying, “This was He of whom I spoke, ‘He that cometh after me is preferred before me, for He was before me.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of His fullness have we all received, and grace for grace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the law was given by Moses, but grace and truth came by Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No man hath seen God at any time; the only begotten Son, who is in the bosom of the Father, He hath declared Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is the record of John, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, “Who art thou?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he confessed and denied not, but confessed, “I am not the Christ.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they asked him, “What then? Art thou Elijah?” And he said, “I am not.” “Art thou that Prophet?” And he answered, “No.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said they unto him, “Who art thou, that we may give an answer to those who sent us? What sayest thou of thyself?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “I am ‘the voice of one crying in the wilderness, “Make straight the way of the Lord,”’ as said the prophet Isaiah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who were sent were of the Pharisees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they asked him, and said unto him, “Why dost thou baptize then if thou art not that Christ, nor Elijah, neither that Prophet?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John answered them, saying, “I baptize with water, but there standeth One among you whom ye know not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He it is who, coming after me, is preferred before me, whose shoe’s strap I am not worthy to unloose.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things were done in Bethabara beyond the Jordan, where John was baptizing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day John saw Jesus coming unto him, and said, “Behold, the Lamb of God, who taketh away the sin of the world!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is He of whom I said, ‘After me cometh a Man who is preferred before me, for He was before me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I knew Him not; but that He should be made manifest to Israel, therefore have I come baptizing with water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And John bore record, saying, “I saw the Spirit descending from Heaven like a dove, and It abode upon Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I knew Him not. But He that sent me to baptize with water, the Same said unto me, ‘Upon whom thou shalt see the Spirit descending and remaining on Him, the Same is He that baptizeth with the Holy Ghost.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I saw and bore record that this is the Son of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again the next day John stood with two of his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and looking upon Jesus as He walked, he said, “Behold the Lamb of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus turned and saw them following, and said unto them, “What seek ye?” They said unto Him, “Rabbi” (which is to say, being interpreted, “Master”), “where dwellest Thou?”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He said unto them, “Come and see.” They came and saw where He dwelt and stayed with Him that day, for it was about the tenth hour.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: One of the two who heard John speak, and followed Him, was Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He first found his own brother Simon and said unto him, “We have found the Messiah” (which is, being interpreted, “the Christ”).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he brought him to Jesus. And when Jesus beheld him, He said, “Thou art Simon, the son of Jonah. Thou shalt be called Cephas” (which is by interpretation, “a stone”).
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The day following, Jesus would go forth into Galilee, and found Philip and said unto him, “Follow Me.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now Philip was of Bethsaida, the city of Andrew and Peter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip found Nathanael and said unto him, “We have found Him of whom Moses in the Law and the Prophets wrote: Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Nathanael said unto him, “Can any good thing come out of Nazareth?” Philip said unto him, “Come and see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to Him, and said of him, “Behold, an Israelite indeed, in whom is no guile!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nathanael said unto Him, “How knowest Thou me?” Jesus answered and said unto him, “Before Philip called thee, when thou wast under the fig tree, I saw thee.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nathanael answered and said unto Him, “Rabbi, Thou art the Son of God; Thou art the King of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said unto him, “Because I said unto thee, ‘I saw thee under the fig tree,’ believest thou? Thou shalt see greater things than these.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And He said unto him, “Verily, verily I say unto you, hereafter ye shall see heaven open, and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of Man.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And on the third day there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee, and the mother of Jesus was there;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and both Jesus and His disciples were called to the marriage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they lacked wine, the mother of Jesus said unto Him, “They have no wine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto her, “Woman, what have I to do with thee? Mine hour is not yet come.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: His mother said unto the servants, “Whatsoever He saith unto you, do it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were set there six waterpots of stone, according to the manner of the purifying of the Jews, holding twenty to thirty gallons apiece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto them, “Fill the waterpots with water.” And they filled them up to the brim.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And He said unto them, “Draw some out now, and bear it unto the governor of the feast.” And they took it.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When the ruler of the feast had tasted the water that was made wine, not knowing from whence it had come (but the servants who drew the water knew), the governor of the feast called the bridegroom
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said unto him, “Every man at the beginning doth set forth good wine, and when men have drunk well, then that which is worse; but thou hast kept the good wine until now.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: This beginning of miracles Jesus did in Cana of Galilee, and manifested forth His glory; and His disciples believed in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this He went down to Capernaum, He and His mother and His brethren and His disciples; and they continued there a few days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Jews’ Passover was at hand, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and found in the temple those who sold oxen and sheep and doves, and also the changers of money, sitting there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when He had made a scourge of small cords, He drove them all out of the temple, with the sheep and the oxen, and poured out the changers’ money and overthrew the tables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said unto those who sold doves, “Take these things hence! Make not My Father’s house a house of merchandise!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And His disciples remembered that it was written: “The zeal of Thine house hath eaten me up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jews answered and said unto Him, “What sign showest thou unto us, seeing that thou doest these things?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said unto them, “Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then said the Jews, “Forty and six years was this temple in building, and wilt thou raise it up in three days?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He spoke of the temple of His body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When therefore He was risen from the dead, His disciples remembered that He had said this unto them. And they believed the Scripture and the Word which Jesus had said.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now when He was in Jerusalem at the Passover on the feast day, many believed in His name when they saw the miracles which He did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus did not commit Himself unto them, because He knew all men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and needed not that any should testify of man, for He knew what was in man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a man of the Pharisees named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The same came to Jesus by night and said unto Him, “Rabbi, we know that thou art a teacher come from God; for no man can do these miracles that thou doest, unless God be with him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said unto him, “Verily, verily I say unto thee, unless a man be born again, he cannot see the Kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nicodemus said unto Him, “How can a man be born when he is old? Can he enter a second time into his mother’s womb and be born?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Verily, verily I say unto thee, unless a man be born of water and of the Spirit, he cannot enter into the Kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: That which is born of the flesh is flesh; and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Marvel not that I said unto thee, ‘Ye must be born again.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The wind bloweth where it will, and thou hearest the sound thereof, but canst not tell whence it cometh and whither it goeth: so is every one that is born of the Spirit.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nicodemus answered and said unto Him, “How can these things be?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said unto him, “Art thou a master of Israel, and knowest not these things?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Verily, verily I say unto thee, we speak what we know and testify what we have seen; and ye receive not our witness.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If I have told you earthly things and ye believe not, how shall ye believe if I tell you of heavenly things?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And no man hath ascended up to Heaven, but He that came down from Heaven, even the Son of Man who is in Heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, even so must the Son of Man be lifted up,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: that whosoever believeth in Him should not perish, but have eternal life.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “For God so loved the world that He gave His only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in Him should not perish, but have everlasting life.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For God sent not His Son into the world to condemn the world, but that the world through Him might be saved.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “He that believeth in Him is not condemned; but He that believeth not is condemned already, because he hath not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And this is the condemnation: that Light is come into the world, and men loved darkness rather than light, because their deeds were evil.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For every one that doeth evil hateth the light, neither cometh to the light, lest his deeds should be reproved.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But he that doeth truth cometh to the light, that his deeds may be made manifest, that they are wrought in God.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: After these things Jesus and His disciples came into the land of Judea, and there He tarried with them, and baptized.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And John also was baptizing at Aenon near Salim, because there was much water there. And they came and were baptized,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for John had not yet been cast into prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then there arose a question between some of John’s disciples and the Jews about purifying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came unto John and said unto him, “Rabbi, He that was with thee beyond the Jordan, to whom thou bearest witness — behold, the same baptizeth and all men come to Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John answered and said, “A man can receive nothing, unless it be given him from Heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Ye yourselves bear me witness that I said, ‘I am not the Christ,’ but that ‘I am sent before Him.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He that hath the bride is the bridegroom; but the friend of the bridegroom, who standeth and heareth him, rejoiceth greatly because of the bridegroom’s voice. This my joy, therefore, is fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He must increase, but I must decrease.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “He that cometh from above is above all; he that is of the earth is earthly and speaketh of the earth. He that cometh from Heaven is above all.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And what He hath seen and heard, to that He testifieth, and no man receiveth His testimony.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He that hath received His testimony hath set his seal to this: that God is true.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For He whom God hath sent speaketh the words of God, for God giveth not the Spirit by measure unto Him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The Father loveth the Son and hath given all things into His hand.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He that believeth in the Son hath everlasting life; and he that believeth not the Son shall not see life, but the wrath of God abideth on him.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When therefore the Lord knew how the Pharisees had heard that Jesus made and baptized more disciples than John
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (though Jesus Himself baptized not, but His disciples),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He left Judea and departed again into Galilee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and He needed to go through Samaria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came He to a city of Samaria, which is called Sychar, near to the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jacob’s well was there. Jesus therefore, being wearied with His journey, sat thus by the well; and it was about the sixth hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There came a woman of Samaria to draw water. Jesus said unto her, “Give Me to drink.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For His disciples had gone away unto the city to buy meat.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said the woman of Samaria unto Him, “How is it that thou, being a Jew, askest a drink of me, who am a woman of Samaria?” For the Jews have no dealings with the Samaritans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said unto her, “If thou knewest the gift of God and who it is that saith to thee, ‘Give Me to drink,’ thou wouldest have asked of Him, and He would have given thee living water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman said unto Him, “Sir, thou hast nothing to draw with, and the well is deep. From whence then hast thou that living water?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Art thou greater than our father Jacob, who gave us the well and drank thereof himself, and his children and his cattle?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said unto her, “Whosoever drinketh of this water shall thirst again,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but whosoever drinketh of the water that I shall give him shall never thirst; but the water that I shall give him shall be in him a well of water springing up into everlasting life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman said unto Him, “Sir, give me this water, that I thirst not, neither come hither to draw.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto her, “Go, call thy husband, and come hither.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman answered and said, “I have no husband.” Jesus said unto her, “Thou hast well said, ‘I have no husband’;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for thou hast had five husbands, and he whom thou now hast is not thy husband. In that thou saidst truly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman said unto Him, “Sir, I perceive that thou art a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our fathers worshiped on this mountain, and ye say that Jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto her, “Woman, believe Me, the hour cometh when ye shall neither on this mountain, nor yet at Jerusalem, worship the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye worship ye know not what; we know what we worship, for salvation is of the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the hour cometh and now is, when the true worshipers shall worship the Father in spirit and in truth; for the Father seeketh such to worship Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God is a Spirit, and they that worship Him must worship Him in spirit and in truth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman said unto Him, “I know that Messiah cometh, who is called Christ. When He has come, He will tell us all things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto her, “I that speak unto thee am He.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And upon this came His disciples and marveled that He talked with the woman; yet no man said, “What seekest Thou?” or, “Why talkest Thou with her?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman then left her waterpot, and went her way into the city and said to the men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Come, see a man who told me all things that ever I did. Is not this the Christ?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they went out of the city and came unto Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile His disciples entreated Him, saying, “Master, eat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He said unto them, “I have meat to eat that ye know not of.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the disciples said one to another, “Hath any man brought Him aught to eat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto them, “My meat is to do the will of Him that sent Me, and to finish His work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say not ye, ‘There are yet four months and then cometh the harvest’? Behold, I say unto you, lift up your eyes and look on the fields, for they are white already to harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he that reapeth receiveth wages and gathereth fruit unto life eternal, that both he that soweth and he that reapeth may rejoice together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And herein is that saying true, ‘One soweth and another reapeth.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I sent you to reap that whereon ye bestowed no labor; other men labored, and ye have entered into their labors.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many of the Samaritans of that city believed in Him because of the saying of the woman who testified, “He told me all that ever I did.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when the Samaritans had come unto Him, they besought Him that He would tarry with them; and He abode there two days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many more believed because of His own word,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said unto the woman, “Now we believe, not because of thy saying, for we have heard Him ourselves and know that this is indeed the Christ, the Savior of the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after two days He departed thence and went into Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Jesus Himself testified that a prophet hath no honor in his own country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when He had come into Galilee, the Galileans received Him, having seen all the things that He did at Jerusalem at the feast; for they also had gone to the feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus came again into Cana of Galilee where He had made the water wine. And there was a certain nobleman, whose son was sick at Capernaum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he heard that Jesus had come out of Judea into Galilee, he went unto Him and besought Him that He would come down and heal his son, for he was at the point of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said unto him, “Unless ye see signs and wonders, ye will not believe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The nobleman said unto Him, “Sir, come down ere my child die!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto him, “Go thy way; thy son liveth.” And the man believed the word that Jesus had spoken unto him, and he went his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he was going down, his servants met him and told him, saying, “Thy son liveth!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he inquired of them the hour when he began to be healed. And they said unto him, “Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the father knew that it was at the same hour in which Jesus had said unto him, “Thy son liveth.” And he himself believed, and his whole house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is again the second miracle that Jesus did when He had come out of Judea into Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this there was a feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there is in Jerusalem by the sheep market a pool, which is called in the Hebrew tongue Bethesda, having five porches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In these lay a great multitude of invalid folk — blind, halt, withered — waiting for the moving of the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For an angel went down at a certain season into the pool and troubled the water. Whosoever then first stepped in, after the troubling of the water, was made whole of whatsoever disease he had.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain man was there who had an infirmity for thirty and eight years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw him lying there, and knew that he had been in that state a long time, He said unto him, “Wilt thou be made whole?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The infirm man answered Him, “Sir, I have no man, when the water is troubled, to put me into the pool; but while I am coming, another steppeth down before me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto him, “Rise, take up thy bed, and walk.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately the man was made whole, and took up his bed and walked. Now it was the Sabbath on that day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews therefore said unto him that was cured, “It is the Sabbath day; it is not lawful for thee to carry thy bed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “He that made me whole said unto me, ‘Take up thy bed and walk.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they asked him, “What man is that who said unto thee, ‘Take up thy bed and walk’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he that was healed knew not who it was, for Jesus had removed Himself away, a multitude being in that place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward Jesus found him in the temple and said unto him, “Behold, thou art made whole. Sin no more, lest a worse thing come unto thee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man departed, and told the Jews that it was Jesus who had made him whole.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And therefore did the Jews persecute Jesus and sought to slay Him, because He had done these things on the Sabbath day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus answered them, “My Father worketh hitherto, and I work.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the Jews sought the more to kill Him, because He not only had broken the Sabbath, but said also that God was His Father, making Himself equal with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then answered Jesus and said unto them, “Verily, verily I say unto you, the Son can do nothing of Himself, but what He seeth the Father do; for what things soever He doeth, these also doeth the Son likewise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Father loveth the Son and showeth Him all things that He Himself doeth; and He will show Him greater works than these, that ye may marvel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as the Father raiseth up the dead and quickeneth them, even so the Son quickeneth whom He will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Father judgeth no man, but hath committed all judgment unto the Son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that all men should honor the Son, even as they honor the Father. He that honoreth not the Son honoreth not the Father who hath sent Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily, verily I say unto you, he that heareth My Word and believeth in Him that sent Me, hath everlasting life and shall not come into condemnation, but is passed from death unto life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Verily, verily I say unto you, the hour is coming and now is, when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God; and they that hear shall live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as the Father hath life in Himself, so hath He given to the Son to have life in Himself,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and hath given Him authority to execute judgment also, because He is the Son of Man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Marvel not at this; for the hour is coming in which all that are in the graves shall hear His voice
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and shall come forth — they that have done good, unto the resurrection of life, and they that have done evil, unto the resurrection of damnation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I can of Mine own self do nothing. As I hear, I judge; and My judgment is just, because I seek not Mine own will, but the will of the Father who hath sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I bear witness of Myself, My witness is not true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is Another that beareth witness of Me, and I know that the witness which He witnesseth of Me is true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Ye sent unto John, and he bore witness unto the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I receive not testimony from man, but these things I say, that ye might be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was a burning and a shining light, and ye were willing for a season to rejoice in his light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have greater witness than that of John; for the works which the Father hath given Me to finish, the same works that I do, bear witness of Me that the Father hath sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Father Himself, who hath sent Me, hath borne witness of Me. Ye have neither heard His voice at any time, nor seen His shape.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye have not His Word abiding in you; for Whom He hath sent, Him ye believe not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Search the Scriptures, for in them ye think ye have eternal life; and it is they which testify of Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye will not come to Me, that ye might have life!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I receive not honor from men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I know you, that ye have not the love of God in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have come in My Father’s name, and ye receive Me not; if another shall come in his own name, him ye will receive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How can ye believe, who receive honor one from another, and seek not the honor that cometh from God only?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not think that I will accuse you to the Father. There is one that accuseth you, even Moses, in whom ye trust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For had ye believed Moses, ye would have believed Me, for he wrote of Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe My words?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things Jesus went across the Sea of Galilee which is the Sea of Tiberias.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a great multitude followed Him, because they saw His miracles which He did on those who were diseased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus went up onto a mountain, and there He sat with His disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Passover, a feast of the Jews, was nigh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Jesus lifted up His eyes and saw a great company coming unto Him, He said unto Philip, “Whence shall we buy bread, that these may eat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this He said to test him, for He Himself knew what He would do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip answered Him, “Two hundred pennyworth of bread is not sufficient for them, that every one of them may take a little.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of His disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, said unto Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There is a lad here who hath five barley loaves and two small fishes, but what are they among so many?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said, “Make the men sit down.” Now there was much grass in the place; so the men sat down, in number about five thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus took the loaves, and when He had given thanks, He distributed to the disciples, and the disciples to those who were sitting down; and likewise of the fishes, as much as they wanted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they were filled, He said unto His disciples, “Gather up the fragments that remain, that nothing be lost.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore they gathered them together, and filled twelve baskets with the fragments of the five barley loaves, which remained over and above, unto them that had eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then those men, when they had seen the miracle that Jesus had done, said, “This is in truth that Prophet who is coming into the world!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus therefore perceived that they would come and take Him by force to make Him a king, He departed again onto a mountain alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as evening had now come, His disciples went down unto the sea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and entered into a boat and went over the sea toward Capernaum. And it was now dark, and Jesus had not come to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sea arose by reason of a great wind that blew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they had rowed about three or four miles, they saw Jesus walking on the sea and drawing nigh unto the boat; and they were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But He said unto them, “It is I; be not afraid.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they willingly received Him into the boat, and immediately the boat was at the land whither they were going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The day following, when the people who stood on the other side of the sea saw that there was no other boat there, save the one into which His disciples had entered, and that Jesus had not gone with His disciples into the boat, but that His disciples had gone away alone
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (however there came other boats from Tiberias nigh unto the place where they had eaten bread after the Lord had given thanks)”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when the people therefore saw that Jesus was not there, neither His disciples, they also took boats and came to Capernaum, seeking for Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had found Him on the other side of the sea, they said unto Him, “Rabbi, when camest thou hither?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them and said, “Verily, verily I say unto you, ye seek Me, not because ye saw the miracles, but because ye ate of the loaves and were filled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Labor not for the meat which perisheth, but for that meat which endureth unto everlasting life, which the Son of Man shall give unto you; for on Him hath God the Father set His seal.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said they unto Him, “What shall we do, that we might work the works of God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said unto them, “This is the work of God: that ye believe in Him whom He hath sent.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said therefore unto Him, “What sign showest thou then, that we may see and believe thee? What works dost thou do?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our fathers ate manna in the desert; as it is written: ‘He gave them bread from heaven to eat.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said unto them, “Verily, verily I say unto you, Moses gave you not that bread from Heaven, but My Father giveth you the true bread from Heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the bread of God is He that cometh down from Heaven, and giveth life unto the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said unto Him, “Lord, evermore give us this bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto them, “I am the Bread of Life. He that cometh to Me shall never hunger, and he that believeth in Me shall never thirst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I said unto you that ye also have seen Me, and believe not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All that the Father giveth Me shall come to Me, and him that cometh to Me I will in no wise cast out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I came down from Heaven, not to do Mine own will, but the will of Him that sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is the Father’s will who hath sent Me, that of all which He hath given Me I should lose nothing, but should raise it up again at the Last Day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is the will of Him that sent Me: that every one who seeth the Son and believeth in Him may have everlasting life, and I will raise him up at the Last Day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews then murmured at Him, because He said, “I am the Bread which came down from Heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “Is not this Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How is it then that he saith, ‘I came down from Heaven’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus therefore answered and said unto them, “Murmur not among yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No man can come to Me unless the Father who hath sent Me draw him; and I will raise him up at the Last Day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is written in the Prophets: ‘And they shall all be taught by God.’ Every man therefore that hath heard and hath learned from the Father cometh unto Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not that any man hath seen the Father, save He that is of God; He hath seen the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily, verily I say unto you, He that believeth in Me hath everlasting life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am that Bread of Life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your fathers ate manna in the wilderness, and are dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the Bread which cometh down from Heaven, that a man may eat thereof and not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the living Bread which came down from Heaven. If any man eat of this Bread, he shall live for ever; and the Bread that I will give is My flesh, which I will give for the life of the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews therefore strove among themselves, saying, “How can this man give us his flesh to eat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said unto them, “Verily, verily I say unto you, unless ye eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink His blood, ye have no life in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoso eateth My flesh and drinketh My blood hath eternal life, and I will raise him up at the Last Day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For My flesh is meat indeed, and My blood is drink indeed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that eateth My flesh and drinketh My blood dwelleth in Me, and I in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the living Father hath sent Me, and I live by the Father, so he that eateth Me, even he shall live by Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is that Bread which came down from Heaven, not as your fathers ate manna and are dead; he that eateth of this Bread shall live for ever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things said He in the synagogue as He taught in Capernaum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many of His disciples therefore, when they had heard this, said, “This is a hard saying; who can hear it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus knew in Himself that His disciples murmured at it, He said unto them, “Doth this offend you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What if ye shall see the Son of Man ascend up where He was before?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is the Spirit that quickeneth; the flesh profiteth nothing. The words that I speak unto you, they are spirit, and they are life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But there are some of you that believe not.” For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were who believed not and who should betray Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said, “Therefore said I unto you that no man can come unto Me, unless it were given unto him by My Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From that time many of His disciples went back and walked no more with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said unto the twelve, “Will ye also go away?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Simon Peter answered Him, “Lord, to whom shall we go? Thou hast the words of eternal life,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and we believe and are sure that Thou art that Christ, the Son of the living God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Have not I chosen you twelve, and one of you is a devil?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke of Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon, for he it was who should betray Him, being one of the twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things, Jesus walked in Galilee, for He would not walk in Judea, because the Jews sought to kill Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Jews’ Feast of Tabernacles was at hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His brethren therefore said unto Him, “Depart hence and go into Judea, that thy disciples also may see the works that thou doest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For no man doeth anything in secret if he himself seeketh to be known openly. If thou do these things, show thyself to the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For neither did His brethren believe in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said unto them, “My time is not yet come, but your time is always ready.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The world cannot hate you, but Me it hateth, because I testify of it that the works thereof are evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go ye up unto this feast. I go not up yet unto this feast, for My time is not yet fully come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had said these words unto them, He remained still in Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when His brethren had gone up, then He also went up unto the feast, not openly but, as it were, in secret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jews sought Him at the feast and said, “Where is he?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was much murmuring among the people concerning Him. For some said, “He is a good man,” and others said, “Nay, for he deceiveth the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet no man spoke openly of Him for fear of the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now about the midst of the feast, Jesus went up into the temple and taught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Jews marveled, saying, “How knoweth this man letters, having never learned?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “My doctrine is not Mine, but His that sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any man will do His will, he shall know of the doctrine whether it be from God, or whether I speak from Myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that speaketh from himself seeketh his own glory; but He that seeketh the glory of Him that sent Him, the same is true, and no unrighteousness is in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did not Moses give you the law, and yet none of you keepeth the law? Why go ye about to kill Me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people answered and said, “Thou hast a devil. Who goeth about to kill thee?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said unto them, “I have done one work, and ye all marvel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses therefore gave unto you circumcision (not because it is of Moses, but of the fathers), and ye on the Sabbath day circumcise a man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man receive circumcision on the Sabbath day, that the Law of Moses should not be broken, are ye angry at Me because I have made a man every whit whole on the Sabbath day?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judge not according to the appearance, but judge righteous judgment.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said some of them from Jerusalem, “Is not this he whom they seek to kill?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But lo, he speaketh boldly, and they say nothing unto him. Do the rulers know indeed that this is the very Christ?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet we know from whence this man comes; but when Christ cometh, no man will know from whence He comes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus cried out in the temple as He taught, saying, “Ye both know Me, and ye know from whence I am. And I am not come of Myself, but He that sent Me is true, whom ye know not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I know Him, for I am from Him, and He hath sent Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they sought to take Him; but no man laid hands on Him, because His hour had not yet come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many of the people believed in Him and said, “When Christ cometh, will He do more miracles than these which this man hath done?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees heard that the people murmured such things concerning Him, and the Pharisees and the chief priests sent officers to take Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Jesus unto them, “Yet a little while am I with you, and then I go unto Him that sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye shall seek Me, and shall not find Me; and where I am, thither ye cannot come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jews said among themselves, “Whither will he go that we shall not find him? Will he go unto the dispersed among the Gentiles, and teach the Gentiles?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What manner of saying is this that he said, ‘Ye shall seek me and shall not find me; and where I am, thither ye cannot come’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the last day, that great day of the feast, Jesus stood and cried out, saying, “If any man thirst, let him come unto Me, and drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that believeth in Me, as the Scripture hath said, out of his belly shall flow rivers of living water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (But this He spoke of the Spirit, whom those who believe in Him should receive; for the Holy Ghost was not yet given, because Jesus was not yet glorified.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many of the people therefore, when they heard this saying, said, “In truth this is the Prophet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others said, “This is the Christ.” But some said, “Shall Christ come out of Galilee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hath not the Scripture said that Christ cometh out of the seed of David, and out of the town of Bethlehem where David was?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So there was a division among the people because of Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some of them would have taken Him, but no man laid hands on Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came the officers to the chief priests and Pharisees, who said unto them, “Why have ye not brought him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The officers answered, “Never did man speak like this man!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Pharisees answered them, “Are ye also deceived?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have any of the rulers or of the Pharisees believed in him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this people, who knoweth not the law, are cursed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nicodemus said unto them (he that came to Jesus by night, being one of them),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Doth our law judge any man before it hear him and know what he doeth?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered and said unto him, “Art thou also from Galilee? Search and look, for out of Galilee ariseth no prophet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every man went unto his own house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went unto the Mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And early in the morning He came again into the temple, and all the people came unto Him; and He sat down and taught them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the scribes and Pharisees brought unto Him a woman taken in adultery. And when they had set her in the midst,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they said unto Him, “Master, this woman was taken in adultery, in the very act.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Moses in the law commanded us that such should be stoned but what sayest thou?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This they said testing Him, that they might have cause to accuse Him. But Jesus stooped down and with His finger wrote on the ground, as though He heard them not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they continued asking Him, He lifted Himself up and said unto them, “He that is without sin among you, let him first cast a stone at her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again He stooped down and wrote on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they who heard it, being convicted by their own conscience, went out one by one, beginning with the eldest even unto the last, and Jesus was left alone with the woman standing in the midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had lifted Himself up and saw none but the woman, He said unto her, “Woman, where are those thine accusers? Hath no man condemned thee?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said, “No man, Lord.” And Jesus said unto her, “Neither do I condemn thee; go, and sin no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then spoke Jesus again unto them, saying, “I am the Light of the world. He that followeth Me shall not walk in darkness, but shall have the light of life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees therefore said unto Him, “Thou bearest record of thyself; thy record is not true.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said unto them, “Though I bear record of Myself, yet My record is true, for I know whence I came and whither I go; but ye cannot tell whence I come and whither I go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye judge according to the flesh; I judge no man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And yet if I judge, My judgment is true; for I am not alone, but I and the Father that sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is also written in your law that the testimony of two men is true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am One that bear witness of Myself, and the Father that sent Me beareth witness of Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said unto Him, “Where is thy father?” Jesus answered, “Ye neither know Me, nor My Father. If ye had known Me, ye should have known My Father also.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These words spoke Jesus in the treasury as He taught in the temple, and no man laid hands on Him, for His hour was not yet come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said again unto them, “I go My way, and ye shall seek Me, and shall die in your sins. Whither I go, ye cannot come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said the Jews, “Will he kill himself, because he saith, ‘Whither I go ye cannot come’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said unto them, “Ye are from beneath; I am from above. Ye are of this world; I am not of this world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I said therefore unto you that ye shall die in your sins; for if ye believe not that I am He, ye shall die in your sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said unto Him, “Who art thou?” And Jesus said unto them, “Even the same that I said unto you from the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have many things to say and to judge of you, but He that sent Me is true; and I speak to the world those things which I have heard of Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They understood not that He spoke to them of the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Jesus unto them, “When ye have lifted up the Son of Man, then shall ye know that I am He, and that I do nothing of Myself; but as My Father hath taught Me, I speak these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He that sent Me is with Me. The Father hath not left Me alone, for I do always those things that please Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As He spoke those words, many believed in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Jesus to those Jews who believed in Him, “If ye continue in My Word, then are ye My disciples indeed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered Him, “We are Abraham’s seed, and were never in bondage to any man. How sayest thou, ‘Ye shall be made free’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Verily, verily I say unto you, whosoever committeth sin is the servant of sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the servant abideth not in the house for ever, but the Son abideth ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the Son therefore shall make you free, ye shall be free indeed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know that ye are Abraham’s seed, but ye seek to kill Me, because My Word hath no place in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I speak that which I have seen with My Father, and ye do that which ye have seen with your father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered and said unto Him, “Abraham is our father.” Jesus said unto them, “If ye were Abraham’s children, ye would do the works of Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now ye seek to kill Me, a Man that hath told you the truth, which I have heard from God: this did not Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye do the deeds of your father.” Then they said to Him, “We are not born of fornication; we have one Father, even God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto them, “If God were your Father, ye would love Me, for I proceeded forth and came from God; neither came I of Myself, but He sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do ye not understand My speech? Even because ye cannot hear My Word!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye are of your father the devil, and the lusts of your father ye will do. He was a murderer from the beginning, and abode not in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaketh a lie, he speaketh of his own, for he is a liar and the father of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because I tell you the truth, ye believe Me not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which of you convicteth Me of sin? And if I say the truth, why do ye not believe Me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that is of God heareth God’s words; ye therefore hear them not, because ye are not of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jews answered and said unto Him, “Say we not well that thou art a Samaritan and hast a devil?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “I have not a devil, but I honor My Father, and ye do dishonor Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I seek not Mine own glory; there is One that seeketh and judgeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily, verily I say unto you, if a man keep My saying, he shall never see death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said the Jews unto Him, “Now we know that thou hast a devil! Abraham is dead and the prophets; and thou sayest, ‘If a man keep my saying he shall never taste of death.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Art thou greater than our father Abraham, who is dead? And the prophets are dead. Whom makest thou thyself?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “If I honor Myself, My honor is nothing. It is My Father that honoreth Me, of whom ye say that He is your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet ye have not known Him, but I know Him. And if I should say, ‘I know Him not,’ I shall be a liar like unto you. But I know Him and keep His saying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your father Abraham rejoiced to see My day; and He saw it and was glad.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said the Jews unto Him, “Thou art not yet fifty years old, and hast thou seen Abraham?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto them, “Verily, verily I say unto you, before Abraham was, I am!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they took up stones to cast at Him; but Jesus hid Himself, and went out of the temple, going through the midst of them, and so passed by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as Jesus passed by, He saw a man who was blind from his birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And His disciples asked Him, saying, “Master, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he was born blind?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Neither hath this man sinned nor his parents, but that the works of God should be made manifest in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I must work the works of Him that sent Me while it is day; the night cometh when no man can work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As long as I am in the world, I am the Light of the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had thus spoken, He spat on the ground and made clay with the spittle; and He anointed the eyes of the blind man with the clay
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said unto him, “Go, wash in the pool of Siloam” (which interpreted means, “Sent”). He went his way therefore and washed, and came back seeing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The neighbors therefore, and those who before had seen that he was blind, said, “Is not this he that sat and begged?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some said, “This is he.” Others said, “He is like him.” But he said, “I am he!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore they said unto him, “How were thine eyes opened?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered and said, “A man who is called Jesus made clay, and anointed mine eyes, and said unto me, ‘Go to the pool of Siloam and wash.’ And I went and washed, and I received sight.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said unto him, “Where is he?” He said, “I know not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought to the Pharisees him that beforehand was blind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was the Sabbath day when Jesus made the clay and opened his eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then again the Pharisees also asked him how he had received his sight. He said unto them, “He put clay upon mine eyes, and I washed and do see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore some of the Pharisees said, “This man is not of God, because he keepeth not the Sabbath day.” Others said, “How can a man who is a sinner do such miracles?” And there was a division among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said unto the blind man again, “What sayest thou of him, that he hath opened thine eyes?” He said, “He is a prophet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Jews did not believe concerning him that he had been blind and received his sight, until they called the parents of him that had received his sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they asked them, saying, “Is this your son, who ye say was born blind? How then doth he now see?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His parents answered them and said, “We know that this is our son and that he was born blind;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but by what means he now seeth we know not, or who hath opened his eyes we know not. He is of age; ask him. He shall speak for himself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These words spoke his parents, because they feared the Jews; for the Jews had agreed already that if any man confessed that He was Christ, he should be put out of the synagogue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore said his parents, “He is of age; ask him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they again called the man who was blind and said unto him, “Give God the praise! We know that this man is a sinner.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered and said, “Whether he be a sinner or not, I know not. One thing I know, that whereas I was blind, now I see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said they to him again, “What did he do to thee? How opened he thine eyes?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “I have told you already, and ye did not hear. Why would ye hear it again? Will ye also be his disciples?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they reviled him and said, “Thou art his disciple, but we are Moses’ disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We know that God spoke unto Moses. As for this fellow, we know not from whence he is.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man answered and said unto them, “Why, herein is a marvelous thing: that ye know not from whence he is, and yet he hath opened mine eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now we know that God heareth not sinners, but if any man be a worshiper of God and doeth His will, him He heareth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since the world began it was not heard that any man opened the eyes of one who was born blind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If this man were not from God, he could do nothing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered and said unto him, “Thou wast altogether born in sins, and dost thou teach us?” And they cast him out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus heard that they had cast him out. And when He had found him, He said unto him, “Dost thou believe in the Son of God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered and said, “Who is he, Lord, that I might believe in him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said unto him, “Thou hast both seen Him, and it is He that talketh with thee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Lord, I believe!” And he worshiped Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus said, “For judgment I am come into this world, that they that see not might see, and that they that see might be made blind.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some of the Pharisees who were with Him heard these words, and said unto Him, “Are we blind also?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto them, “If ye were blind, ye should have no sin; but now ye say, ‘We see.’ Therefore your sin remaineth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Verily, verily I say unto you, he that entereth not by the door into the sheepfold, but climbeth up some other way, the same is a thief and a robber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he that entereth in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To him the doorkeeper openeth, and the sheep hear his voice; and he calleth his own sheep by name and leadeth them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he putteth forth his own sheep, he goeth before them and the sheep follow him, for they know his voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a stranger will they not follow, but will flee from him, for they know not the voice of strangers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This parable Jesus spoke unto them, but they understood not what things they were which He spoke unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Jesus unto them again, “Verily, verily I say unto you, I am the door of the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All that ever came before Me are thieves and robbers, but the sheep did not hear them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the door; by Me if any man enter in, he shall be saved, and shall go in and out, and find pasture.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The thief cometh not but to steal and to kill and to destroy. I am come that they might have life, and that they might have it more abundantly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the Good Shepherd; the Good Shepherd giveth His life for the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he that is a hireling and not the shepherd, whose own the sheep are not, seeth the wolf coming and leaveth the sheep and fleeth; and the wolf catcheth them and scattereth the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hireling fleeth because he is a hireling, and careth not for the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the Good Shepherd, and know My sheep and am known by Mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the Father knoweth Me, even so know I the Father; and I lay down My life for the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And other sheep I have, which are not of this fold. Them also I must bring, and they shall hear My voice; and there shall be one fold and one Shepherd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore doth My Father love Me, because I lay down My life, that I might take it again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No man taketh it from Me, but I lay it down of Myself. I have power to lay it down, and I have power to take it again. This commandment have I received from My Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a division therefore again among the Jews for these sayings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many of them said, “He hath a devil and is mad. Why hear ye him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others said, “These are not the words of him that hath a devil. Can a devil open the eyes of the blind?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was at Jerusalem the Feast of the Dedication, and it was winter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus walked in the temple in Solomon’s Porch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came the Jews round about Him and said unto Him, “How long dost thou make us to doubt? If thou be the Christ, tell us plainly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “I told you, and ye believed not. The works that I do in My Father’s name, they bear witness of Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ye believe not, because ye are not of My sheep, as I said unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My sheep hear My voice, and I know them and they follow Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I give unto them eternal life, and they shall never perish, neither shall any man pluck them out of My hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My Father, who gave them to Me, is greater than all; and no man is able to pluck them out of My Father’s hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I and My Father are one.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jews took up stones again to stone Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Many good works have I shown you from My Father. For which of those works do ye stone Me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews answered Him, saying, “For a good work we stone thee not, but for blasphemy and because thou, being a man, makest thyself God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Is it not written in your law, ‘I said “Ye are gods”’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If He called them gods unto whom the Word of God came (and the Scripture cannot be broken),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: do ye say of Him whom the Father hath sanctified and sent into the world, ‘Thou blasphemest,’ because I said, ‘I am the Son of God’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I do not the works of My Father, believe Me not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I do, though ye believe not Me, believe the works, that ye may know and believe that the Father is in Me, and I in Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore they sought again to take Him, but He escaped out of their hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and went away again beyond the Jordan into the place where John had first baptized; and there He abode.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many resorted unto Him and said that John did no miracle, but all things that John spoke of this Man were true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many believed in Him there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a certain man was sick named Lazarus, of Bethany, the town of Mary and her sister Martha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (It was that Mary who had anointed the Lord with ointment and wiped His feet with her hair, whose brother Lazarus was sick.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore his sisters sent unto Him, saying, “Lord, behold, he whom Thou lovest is sick.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard that, He said, “This sickness is not unto death, but for the glory of God, that the Son of God might be glorified thereby.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jesus loved Martha and her sister and Lazarus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He heard therefore that Lazarus was sick, He stayed two days still in the same place where He was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then after that He said to His disciples, “Let us go into Judea again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples said unto Him, “Master, the Jews of late sought to stone Thee, and goest Thou thither again?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Are there not twelve hours in the day? If any man walk in the day he stumbleth not, because he seeth the light of this world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if a man walk in the night, he stumbleth because there is no light in him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things said He, and after that He said unto them, “Our friend Lazarus sleepeth; but I go, that I may awaken him out of sleep.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said His disciples, “Lord, if he sleep he shall do well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However Jesus spoke of his death, but they thought that He had spoken of the taking of rest in sleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said unto them plainly, “Lazarus is dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I am glad for your sakes that I was not there, to the intent that ye may believe. Nevertheless let us go unto him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Thomas, who was called Didymus, said unto his fellow disciples, “Let us also go, that we may die with Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when Jesus came, He found that he had lain in the grave four days already.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Bethany was nigh unto Jerusalem, about two miles away,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and many of the Jews came to Martha and Mary to comfort them concerning their brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Martha, as soon as she heard that Jesus was coming, went and met Him; but Mary sat still in the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Martha said unto Jesus, “Lord, if Thou hadst been here, my brother would not have died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I know that even now, whatsoever Thou wilt ask of God, God will give it Thee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto her, “Thy brother shall rise again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Martha said unto Him, “I know that he shall rise again at the resurrection on the Last Day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto her, “I am the resurrection and the Life. He that believeth in Me, though he were dead, yet shall he live;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and whosoever liveth and believeth in Me shall never die. Believest thou this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said unto Him, “Yea, Lord, I believe that Thou art the Christ, the Son of God, who should come into the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when she had so said, she went her way and called Mary her sister secretly, saying, “The Master has come, and calleth for thee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as she heard that, she arose quickly and came unto Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jesus had not yet come into the town, but was in that place where Martha met Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews then, who were with her in the house and comforting her, when they saw that Mary rose up hastily and went out, followed her, saying, “She goeth unto the grave to weep there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when Mary had come where Jesus was and saw Him, she fell down at His feet, saying unto Him, “Lord, if Thou hadst been here, my brother would not have died.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus therefore saw her weeping, and the Jews also weeping who came with her, He groaned in the spirit and was troubled,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “Where have ye laid him?” They said unto Him, “Lord, come and see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said the Jews, “Behold, how he loved him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some of them said, “Could not this man, who opened the eyes of the blind, have caused that even this man should not have died?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus therefore again, groaning in Himself, came to the grave. It was a cave, and a stone lay against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Take ye away the stone.” Martha, the sister of him that was dead, said unto Him, “Lord, by this time there is a stench, for he hath been dead four days.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto her, “Said I not unto thee that if thou would believe, thou should see the glory of God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they took away the stone from the place where the dead was laid. And Jesus lifted up His eyes and said, “Father, I thank Thee that Thou hast heard Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I knew that Thou hearest Me always, but because of the people who stand by I said it, that they may believe that Thou hast sent Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when He thus had spoken, He cried with a loud voice, “Lazarus, come forth!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he that was dead came forth, bound hand and foot with graveclothes, and his face was bound about with a napkin. Jesus said unto them, “Loose him, and let him go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then many of the Jews who came to Mary and had seen the things which Jesus did, believed in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of them went their ways to the Pharisees, and told them what things Jesus had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then gathered the chief priests and the Pharisees a council and said, “What shall we do? For this man doeth many miracles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we let him thus alone, all men will believe in him, and the Romans shall come and take away both our place and nation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of them named Caiaphas, being the high priest that same year, said unto them, “Ye know nothing at all,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor consider that it is expedient for us that one man should die for the people, and that the whole nation perish not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spoke this not of himself, but, being high priest that year, he prophesied that Jesus should die for that nation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and not for that nation only, but that also He should gather together in one the children of God who were scattered abroad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So from that day forth, they took counsel together to put Him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus therefore walked no longer openly among the Jews, but went thence unto a region near the wilderness into a city called Ephraim, and there continued with His disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Jews’ Passover was nigh at hand, and many went out of the country up to Jerusalem before the Passover to purify themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they sought for Jesus and spoke among themselves as they stood in the temple, saying, “What think ye — that he will not come to the feast?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now both the chief priests and the Pharisees had given a command that if any man knew where He was, he should report it, that they might take Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus, six days before the Passover, came to Bethany where Lazarus was, who had been dead and whom He had raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There they made Him a supper; and Martha served, but Lazarus was one of those who sat at the table with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Mary took a pound of ointment of spikenard, very costly, and anointed the feet of Jesus and wiped His feet with her hair; and the house was filled with the odor of the ointment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of His disciples, Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son who was to betray Him, said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why was not this ointment sold for three hundred pence and given to the poor?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This he said, not that he cared for the poor, but because he was a thief, and had the money bag and took what was put therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said, “Let her alone; against the day of My burying hath she kept this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the poor always ye have with you, but Me ye have not always.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many people of the Jews therefore knew that He was there. And they came not for Jesus’ sake only, but that they might see Lazarus also, whom He had raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the chief priests consulted, that they might put Lazarus also to death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because by reason of him many of the Jews went away and believed in Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next day many people who had come to the feast, when they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: took branches of palm trees and went forth to meet Him and cried, “Hosanna! Blessed is the King of Israel that cometh in the name of the Lord!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus, when He had found a young ass, sat thereon, as it is written:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Fear not, daughter of Zion; behold, thy King cometh, sitting on an ass’s colt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
