verses.text: These things His disciples understood not at first; but when Jesus was glorified, then they remembered that these things were written of Him, and that they had done these things unto Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people therefore who were with Him, when He called Lazarus out of his grave and raised him from the dead, bore record.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this cause the people also met Him, for they heard that He had done this miracle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees therefore said among themselves, “Perceive ye how ye prevail not at all? Behold, the world has gone after him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were certain Greeks among them, who came up to worship at the feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came therefore to Philip, who was of Bethsaida of Galilee, and asked him, saying, “Sir, we would see Jesus.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip went and told Andrew, and again Andrew and Philip told Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus answered them, saying, “The hour is come that the Son of Man should be glorified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily, verily I say unto you, unless a grain of wheat fall into the ground and die, it abideth alone; but if it die, it bringeth forth much fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that loveth his life shall lose it, and he that hateth his life in this world shall keep it unto life eternal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any man serve Me, let him follow Me; and where I am, there shall also My servant be. If any man serve Me, him will My Father honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now is My soul troubled, and what shall I say? ‘Father, save Me from this hour’? But for this cause came I unto this hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Father, glorify Thy name.” Then there came a voice from Heaven, saying, “I Have Both Glorified It, And Will Glorify It Again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people therefore who stood by and heard it said that it thundered. Others said, “An angel spoke to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said, “This voice came not because of Me, but for your sakes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now is the judgment of this world; now shall the prince of this world be cast out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I, if I be lifted up from the earth, will draw all men unto Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This He said, signifying what death He should die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people answered Him, “We have heard from the law that Christ abideth for ever; and how sayest thou, ‘The Son of Man must be lifted up’? Who is this son of man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said unto them, “Yet a little while is the Light with you. Walk while ye have the Light, lest darkness come upon you; for he that walketh in darkness knoweth not whither he goeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While ye have Light, believe in the Light, that ye may be the children of Light.” These things spoke Jesus, and departed and hid Himself from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But though He had done so many miracles before them, yet they believed not in Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the saying of Isaiah the prophet might be fulfilled, which he spoke: “Lord, who hath believed our report? And to whom hath the arm of the Lord been revealed?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore they could not believe, because as Isaiah said again:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He hath blinded their eyes and hardened their heart, that they should not see with their eyes, nor understand with their heart, and be converted, and I should heal them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things said Isaiah when he saw His glory and spoke of Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, among the chief rulers also, many believed in Him, but because of the Pharisees they did not confess Him, lest they should be put out of the synagogue;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for they loved the praise of men more than the praise of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus cried out and said, “He that believeth in Me, believeth not in Me, but in Him that sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he that seeth Me, seeth Him that sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am come a light into the world, that whosoever believeth in Me should not abide in darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if any man hear My words and believe not, I judge him not; for I came not to judge the world, but to save the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that rejecteth Me and receiveth not My words, hath One that judgeth him; the Word that I have spoken, the same shall judge him in the Last Day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have not spoken of Myself; but the Father who sent Me, He gave Me a commandment, what I should say and what I should speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I know that His commandment is life everlasting. Whatsoever I speak therefore, even as the Father said unto Me, so I speak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now before the Feast of the Passover, when Jesus knew that His hour had come that He should depart out of this world unto the Father, having loved His own who were in the world, He loved them unto the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And supper being ended, and the devil having now put into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son, to betray Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus, knowing that the Father had given all things into His hands and that He had come from God and was going to God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: rose from supper and laid aside His garments, and took a towel and girded Himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After that He poured water into a basin, and began to wash the disciples’ feet and to wipe them with the towel wherewith He was girded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came He to Simon Peter, and Peter said unto Him, “Lord, dost Thou wash my feet?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said unto him, “What I do thou knowest not now, but thou shalt know hereafter.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said unto Him, “Thou shalt never wash my feet.” Jesus answered him, “If I wash thee not, thou hast no part with Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter said unto Him, “Lord, not my feet only, but also my hands and my head.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “He that is washed needeth not but to wash his feet, but is clean every whit. And ye are clean, but not all.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For He knew who would betray Him; therefore He said, “Ye are not all clean.”)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So after He had washed their feet and had taken His garments and had sat down again, He said unto them, “Know ye what I have done to you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye call Me Master and Lord; and ye say well, for so I am.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I then, your Lord and Master, have washed your feet, ye also ought to wash one another’s feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have given you an example, that ye should do as I have done to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily, verily I say unto you, the servant is not greater than his lord, neither he that is sent greater than he that sent him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If ye know these things, happy are ye if ye do them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I speak not of you all. I know whom I have chosen; but that the Scripture may be fulfilled, ‘He that eateth bread with Me hath lifted up his heel against Me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I tell you before it come that, when it is come to pass, ye may believe that I am He.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily, verily I say unto you, he that receiveth whomsoever I send, receiveth Me; and he that receiveth Me, receiveth Him that sentMe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had thus said, He was troubled in spirit, and testified and said, “Verily, verily I say unto you that one of you shall betray Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples looked at one another, not knowing of whom He spoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was leaning on Jesus’ bosom one of His disciples, whom Jesus loved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter therefore beckoned to him, that he should ask who it should be of whom He spoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He then, leaning on Jesus’ breast, said unto Him, “Lord, who is it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “He it is to whom I shall give a sop when I have dipped it.” And when He had dipped the sop, He gave it to Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after the sop, Satan entered into him. Then Jesus said unto him, “What thou doest, do quickly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now no man at the table knew with what intent He spoke this unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For some of them thought, because Judas had the money bag, that Jesus had said unto him, “Buy those things that we have need of for the feast,” or that he should give something to the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas then, having received the sop, went immediately out. And it was night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore when he had gone out, Jesus said, “Now is the Son of Man glorified, and God is glorified in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If God be glorified in Him, God shall also glorify Him in Himself, and shall straightway glorify Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Little children, yet a little while I am with you. Ye shall seek Me; and as I said unto the Jews, ‘Whither I go ye cannot come,’ so now say I to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A new commandment I give unto you: that ye love one another, as I have loved you, that ye also love one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By this shall all men know that ye are My disciples: if ye have love one for another.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter said unto Him, “Lord, whither goest Thou?” Jesus answered him, “Whither I go thou canst not follow Me now, but thou shalt follow Me afterwards.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said unto Him, “Lord, why cannot I follow Thee now? I will lay down my life for Thy sake.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “Wilt thou lay down thy life for My sake? Verily, verily I say unto thee, the cock shall not crow till thou hast denied Me thrice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let not your heart be troubled. Ye believe in God; believe also in Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In My Father’s house are many mansions; if it were not so, I would have told you. I go to prepare a place for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if I go and prepare a place for you, I will come again and receive you unto Myself, that where I am, there ye may be also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whither I go ye know, and the way ye know.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thomas said unto Him, “Lord, we know not whither Thou goest; and how can we know the way?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto him, “I am the Way, the Truth, and the Life; no man cometh unto the Father, but by Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If ye had known Me, ye should have known My Father also; and from henceforth ye know Him, and have seen Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip said unto Him, “Lord, show us the Father, and it sufficeth us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto him, “Have I been so long a time with you, and yet hast thou not known Me, Philip? He that hath seen Me hath seen the Father; and how sayest thou then, ‘Show us the Father’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Believest thou not that I am in the Father, and the Father in Me? The words that I speak unto you I speak not of Myself; but the Father that dwelleth in Me, He doeth the works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Believe Me that I am in the Father, and the Father in Me; or else believe Me for the very works’ sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily, verily I say unto you, he that believeth in Me, the works that I do he shall do also; and greater works than these shall he do, because I go unto My Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whatsoever ye shall ask in My name, that will I do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If ye shall ask anything in My name, I will do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If ye love Me, keep My commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will pray the Father, and He shall give you another Comforter, that He may abide with you for ever”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even the Spirit of Truth, whom the world cannot receive, because it seeth Him not, neither knoweth Him. But ye know Him, for He dwelleth with you, and shall be in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I will not leave you comfortless; I will come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet a little while and the world seeth Me no more, but ye see Me. Because I live, ye shall live also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that day ye shall know that I am in My Father, and you in Me, and I in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that hath My commandments and keepeth them, he it is that loveth Me; and he that loveth Me shall be loved by My Father, and I will love him and will manifest Myself to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas (not Iscariot) said unto Him, “Lord, how is it that Thou wilt manifest Thyself unto us, and not unto the world?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered and said unto him, “If a man love Me, he will keep My words; and My Father will love him, and We will come unto him and make Our abode with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that loveth Me not, keepeth not My sayings. And the Word which you hear is not Mine, but the Father’s who sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These things have I spoken unto you, being yet present with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Comforter, who is the Holy Ghost whom the Father will send in My name, He shall teach you all things and bring all things to your remembrance, whatsoever I have said unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Peace I leave with you; My peace I give unto you, not as the world giveth, give I unto you. Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it be afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye have heard how I said unto you, ‘I go away and come again unto you.’ If ye loved Me, ye would rejoice because I said, ‘I go unto the Father,’ for My Father is greater than I.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now I have told you before it come to pass, that when it is come to pass, ye might believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hereafter I will not talk much with you, for the prince of this world cometh, and hath nothing in Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that the world may know that I love the Father, as the Father gave Me commandment, even so I do. Arise, let us go hence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the true vine, and My Father is the husbandman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every branch in Me that beareth not fruit He taketh away; and every branch that beareth fruit, He purgeth it, that it may bring forth more fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now ye are clean through the Word which I have spoken unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Abide in Me, and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself, unless it abide in the vine, no more can ye, unless ye abide in Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the vine, ye are the branches. He that abideth in Me and I in Him, the same bringeth forth much fruit, for without Me ye can do nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man abide not in Me, he is cast forth as a branch and is withered; and men gather them and cast them into the fire, and they are burned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If ye abide in Me, and My words abide in you, ye shall ask what ye will, and it shall be done unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Herein is My Father glorified, that ye bear much fruit; so shall ye be My disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As the Father hath loved Me, so have I loved you. Continue ye in My love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If ye keep My commandments, ye shall abide in My love, even as I have kept My Father’s commandments, and abide in His love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things have I spoken unto you, that My joy might remain in you, and that your joy might be full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is My commandment: that ye love one another, as I have loved you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye are My friends if ye do whatsoever I command you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Henceforth I call you not servants, for the servant knoweth not what his lord doeth; but I have called you friends, for all things that I have heard of My Father, I have made known unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye have not chosen Me, but I have chosen you and ordained you, that ye should go and bring forth fruit and that your fruit should remain, that whatsoever ye shall ask of the Father in My name, He may give it to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things I command you, that ye love one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If the world hate you, ye know that it hated Me before it hated you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If ye were of the world, the world would love his own; but because ye are not of the world, but I have chosen you out of the world, therefore the world hateth you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember the word that I said unto you: ‘The servant is not greater than his lord.’ If they have persecuted Me, they will also persecute you; if they have kept My saying, they will keep yours also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all these things will they do unto you for My name’s sake, because they know not Him that sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I had not come and spoken unto them, they would not have sin, but now they have no cloak for their sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that hateth Me hateth My Father also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I had not done among them the works which no other man did, they would not have had sin; but now they have both seen and hated both Me and My Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this cometh to pass, that the word might be fulfilled that is written in their law: ‘They hated Me without a cause.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when the Comforter is come, whom I will send unto you from the Father, even the Spirit of Truth who proceedeth from the Father, He shall testify of Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye also shall bear witness, because ye have been with Me from the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These things have I spoken unto you, that ye should not lose faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall put you out of the synagogues; yea, the time cometh that whosoever killeth you will think that he doeth God service.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these things will they do unto you, because they have not known the Father, nor Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But these things have I told you, that when the time shall come, ye may remember that I told you of them. “And these things I said not unto you at the beginning, because I was with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now I go My way to Him that sent Me, and none of you asketh Me, ‘Whither goest Thou?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But because I have said these things unto you, sorrow hath filled your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless I tell you the truth. It is expedient for you that I go away, for if I go not away, the Comforter will not come unto you; but if I depart, I will send Him unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when He is come, He will reprove the world concerning sin, and concerning righteousness, and concerning judgment:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: concerning sin, because they believe not in Me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: concerning righteousness, because I go to My Father and ye see Me no more;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: concerning judgment, because the prince of this world is judged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have yet many things to say unto you, but ye cannot bear them now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However when He, the Spirit of Truth, is come, He will guide you into all truth; for He shall not speak from Himself, but whatsoever He shall hear, that shall He speak; and He will show you things to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall glorify Me, for He shall receive of Mine, and shall show it unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All things that the Father hath are Mine; therefore I said that He shall take of Mine, and shall show it unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A little while, and ye shall not see Me; and again a little while, and ye shall see Me, because I go to the Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said some of His disciples among themselves, “What is this that He saith unto us, ‘A little while, and ye shall not see Me; and again a little while, and ye shall see Me,’ and, ‘because I go to the Father’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said therefore, “What is this that He saith, ‘A little while’? We cannot tell what He saith.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jesus knew that they were desirous of asking Him, and said unto them, “Do ye inquire among yourselves of what I said, ‘A little while, and ye shall not see Me; and again a little while, and ye shall see Me’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily, verily I say unto you that ye shall weep and lament, but the world shall rejoice; and ye shall be sorrowful, but your sorrow shall be turned into joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A woman when she is in travail hath sorrow, because her hour is come; but as soon as she is delivered of the child, she remembereth no more the anguish, for the joy that a man is born into the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye now therefore have sorrow; but I will see you again, and your heart shall rejoice, and your joy no man taketh from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in that day ye shall ask Me nothing. Verily, verily I say unto you, whatsoever ye shall ask the Father in My name, He will give it to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hitherto have ye asked nothing in My name. Ask and ye shall receive, that your joy may be full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These things have I spoken unto you in proverbs; but the time cometh when I shall no more speak unto you in proverbs, but I shall show you plainly of the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day ye shall ask in My name, and I say not unto you that I will pray the Father for you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the Father Himself loveth you, because ye have loved Me and have believed that I came out from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I came forth from the Father, and am come into the world. Again, I leave the world and go to the Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples said unto Him, “Lo, now speakest Thou plainly and speakest no proverb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now are we sure that Thou knowest all things and needest not that any man should ask Thee. By this we believe that Thou camest forth from God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Do ye now believe?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, the hour cometh, yea, is now come, that ye shall be scattered, every man to his own, and shall leave Me alone. And yet I am not alone, because the Father is with Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things I have spoken unto you, that in Me ye might have peace. In the world ye shall have tribulation, but be of good cheer: I have overcome the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These words spoke Jesus and lifted up His eyes to Heaven and said, “Father, the hour is come. Glorify Thy Son, that Thy Son also may glorify Thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as Thou hast given Him power over all flesh, that He should give eternal life to as many as Thou hast given Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is life eternal: that they might know Thee, the only true God, and Jesus Christ whom Thou hast sent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have glorified Thee on the earth; I have finished the work which Thou gavest Me to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, O Father, glorify Thou Me with Thine own Self with the glory which I had with Thee before the world was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have manifested Thy name unto the men whom Thou gavest Me out of the world. Thine they were, and Thou gavest them to Me, and they have kept Thy Word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now they have known that all things whatsoever Thou hast given Me are of Thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have given unto them the Words which Thou gavest Me; and they have received them and have known surely that I came out from Thee, and they have believed that Thou didst send Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I pray for them; I pray not for the world, but for them whom Thou hast given Me, for they are Thine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all Mine are Thine, and Thine are Mine, and I am glorified in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now I am no more in the world, but these are in the world, and I come to Thee. Holy Father, keep through Thine own name those whom Thou hast given Me, that they may be one, as We are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While I was with them in the world, I kept them in Thy name. Those that Thou gavest Me I have kept, and none of them is lost, but the son of perdition, that the Scripture might be fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And now come I to Thee, and these things I speak in the world, that they might have My joy fulfilled in themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have given them Thy Word, and the world hath hated them, because they are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I pray not that Thou shouldest take them out of the world, but that Thou shouldest keep them from the evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sanctify them through Thy truth: Thy Word is truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Thou hast sent Me into the world, even so have I also sent them into the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for their sakes I sanctify Myself, that they also might be sanctified through the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Neither pray I for these alone, but for them also who shall believe in Me through their word,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that they all may be one, as Thou, Father, art in Me and I in Thee, that they also may be one in Us, that the world may believe that Thou hast sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the glory which Thou gavest Me I have given them, that they may be one, even as We are one:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I in them and Thou in Me, that they may be made perfect in one, and that the world may know that Thou hast sent Me and hast loved them, as Thou hast loved Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Father, I will that they also, whom Thou hast given Me, be with Me where I am, that they may behold My glory which Thou hast given Me; for Thou loved Me before the foundation of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “O righteous Father, the world hath not known Thee, but I have known Thee, and these have known that Thou hast sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I have declared unto them Thy name, and will declare it, that the love wherewith Thou hast loved Me may be in them, and I in them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had spoken these words, He went forth with His disciples over the Brook Kidron, where was a garden into which He entered with His disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Judas also, who betrayed Him, knew the place, for Jesus oftentimes resorted thither with His disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas then, having received a band of men and officers from the chief priests and Pharisees, came thither with lanterns and torches and weapons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus therefore, knowing all things that should come upon Him, went forth and said unto them, “Whom seek ye?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered Him, “Jesus of Nazareth.” Jesus said unto them, “I am He.” And Judas also, who betrayed Him, stood with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon then as He had said unto them, “I am He,” they went backward and fell to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then asked He them again, “Whom seek ye?” And they said, “Jesus of Nazareth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “I have told you that I am He. If therefore ye seek Me, let these go their way,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the saying might be fulfilled which He spoke, “Of those that Thou gavest Me, have I lost none.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Simon Peter, having a sword, drew it and smote the high priest’s servant and cut off his right ear. The servant’s name was Malchus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Jesus unto Peter, “Put up thy sword into the sheath. The cup which My Father hath given Me, shall I not drink it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the band and the captain and officers of the Jews took Jesus and bound Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and led Him away to Annas first, for he was the father-in-law of Caiaphas, who was the high priest that same year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it was Caiaphas who gave counsel to the Jews that it was expedient that one man should die for the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Simon Peter followed Jesus, and so did another disciple. That disciple was known unto the high priest, and went in with Jesus into the palace of the high priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter stood at the door outside. Then the other disciple, who was known unto the high priest, went out and spoke unto her who kept the door, and brought in Peter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the damsel who kept the door said unto Peter, “Art not thou also one of this man’s disciples?” He said, “I am not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the servants and officers stood there, who had made a fire of coals, for it was cold and they warmed themselves. And Peter stood with them, and warmed himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The high priest then asked Jesus about His disciples and about His doctrine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “I spoke openly to the world; I ever taught in the synagogue and in the temple whither the Jews always resort, and in secret have I said nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why askest thou Me? Ask them that heard Me what I have said unto them. Behold, they know what I said.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when He had thus spoken, one of the officers who stood by struck Jesus with the palm of his hand, saying, “Answerest thou the high priest so?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “If I have spoken evil, bear witness of the evil; but if well, why smitest thou Me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Annas had sent Him bound unto Caiaphas, the high priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Simon Peter stood and warmed himself. They said therefore unto him, “Art not thou also one of his disciples?” He denied it and said, “I am not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the servants of the high priest, being kinsman of him whose ear Peter cut off, said, “Did not I see thee in the garden with him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter then denied again; and immediately the cock crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they led Jesus from Caiaphas unto the hall of judgment. And it was early, and they themselves went not into the judgment hall, lest they should be defiled, but that they might eat the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate then went out unto them and said, “What accusation bring ye against this man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered and said unto him, “If he were not a malefactor, we would not have delivered him up unto thee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Pilate unto them, “Take ye him and judge him according to your law.” The Jews therefore said unto him, “It is not lawful for us to put any man to death,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the saying which Jesus had spoken, signifying what death He should die, might be fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate entered into the judgment hall again, and called Jesus and said unto Him, “Art thou the King of the Jews?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “Sayest thou this thing of thyself, or did others tell it thee of Me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate answered, “Am I a Jew? Thine own nation and the chief priests have delivered thee unto me. What hast thou done?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “My Kingdom is not of this world. If My Kingdom were of this world, then would My servants fight, that I should not be delivered to the Jews. But now is My Kingdom not from hence.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate therefore said unto Him, “Art thou a king then?” Jesus answered, “Thou sayest that I am a king. To this end was I born, and for this cause came I into the world, that I should bear witness unto the truth. Every one that is of the truth heareth My voice.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate said unto Him, “What is truth?” And when he said this, he went out again unto the Jews, and said unto them, “I find in him no fault at all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ye have a custom that I should release unto you one at the Passover. Will ye therefore that I release unto you the King of the Jews?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then cried they all again, saying, “Not this man, but Barabbas!” Now Barabbas was a robber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate therefore took Jesus and scourged Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the soldiers plaited a crown of thorns and put it on His head, and they put on Him a purple robe
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “Hail, King of the Jews!” And they smote Him with their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate therefore went forth again and said unto them, “Behold, I bring him forth to you, that ye may know that I find no fault in him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came Jesus forth, wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe. And Pilate said unto them, “Behold the man!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When therefore the chief priests and the officers saw Him, they cried out, saying, “Crucify him! Crucify him!” Pilate said unto them, “Ye take him and crucify him, for I find no fault in him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews answered him, “We have a law, and by our law he ought to die, because he made himself the Son of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pilate therefore heard that saying, he was the more afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went again into the judgment hall and said unto Jesus, “From whence art thou?” But Jesus gave him no answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Pilate unto Him, “Speakest thou not unto me? Knowest thou not that I have power to crucify thee, and have power to release thee?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Thou couldest have no power at all against Me, unless it were given thee from above. Therefore he that delivered Me unto thee hath the greater sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from thenceforth Pilate sought to release Him, but the Jews cried out, saying, “If thou let this man go, thou art not Caesar’s friend. Whosoever maketh himself a king speaketh against Caesar.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pilate therefore heard that saying, he brought Jesus forth and sat down in the judgment seat in a place that is called the Pavement, but in Hebrew, Gabbatha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was the Preparation of the Passover and about the sixth hour, and Pilate said unto the Jews, “Behold your king!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they cried out, “Away with him, away with him! Crucify him!” Pilate said unto them, “Shall I crucify your king?” The chief priests answered, “We have no king but Caesar!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he delivered Him therefore unto them to be crucified. And they took Jesus and led Him away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He, bearing His cross, went forth into a place called the Place of a Skull (which is called in the Hebrew, Golgotha)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: where they crucified Him and two others with Him, one on either side and Jesus in the midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pilate wrote a title and put it on the cross. And the writing was: Jesus Of Nazareth The King Of The Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then many of the Jews read this title, for the place where Jesus was crucified was nigh to the city, and it was written in Hebrew and Greek and Latin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said the chief priests of the Jews to Pilate, “Write not ‘The King of the Jews,’ but, ‘He said, I am King of the Jews.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate answered, “What I have written, I have written.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the soldiers, when they had crucified Jesus, took His garments and made four parts, to every soldier a part, and also His coat. Now the coat was without seam, woven from the top throughout.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said therefore among themselves, “Let us not rend it, but cast lots for it, whose it shall be,” that the Scripture might be fulfilled which saith, “They parted My raiment among them, and for My vesture did they cast lots.” These things therefore the soldiers did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there stood by the cross of Jesus His mother and His mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus therefore saw His mother and the disciple standing by whom He loved, He said unto His mother, “Woman, behold thy son!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said He to the disciple, “Behold thy mother!” And from that hour, that disciple took her unto his own home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this Jesus, knowing that all things were now accomplished, that the Scripture might be fulfilled, said, “I thirst.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was set there a vessel full of vinegar; and they filled a sponge with vinegar and put it upon hyssop, and put it to His mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus therefore had received the vinegar, He said, “It is finished.” And He bowed His head and gave up the ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews therefore, because it was the Preparation, and so that the bodies should not remain upon the cross on the Sabbath day (for that Sabbath day was a high day), besought Pilate that their legs might be broken and that they might be taken away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came the soldiers and broke the legs of the first and of the other who was crucified with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they came to Jesus and saw that He was dead already, they broke not His legs,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but one of the soldiers with a spear pierced His side, and forthwith there came out blood and water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he that saw it bore record, and his record is true, and he knoweth that he saith truly, that ye might believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For these things were done, that the Scripture should be fulfilled: “A bone of Him shall not be broken.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again another Scripture saith, “They shall look on Him whom they pierced.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after this, Joseph of Arimathea, being a disciple of Jesus, but secretly for fear of the Jews, besought Pilate that he might take away the body of Jesus; and Pilate gave him leave. He came therefore and took the body of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there came also Nicodemus, who at first came to Jesus by night, and brought a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about a hundred pounds in weight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then took they the body of Jesus and wound it in linen cloths with the spices, as is the manner of the Jews for burial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the place where He was crucified there was a garden, and in the garden a new sepulcher wherein was never man yet laid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There they laid Jesus therefore because of the Jews’ Preparation Day, for the sepulcher was nigh at hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day of the week came Mary Magdalene early, when it was yet dark, unto the sepulcher and saw the stone taken away from the sepulcher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she ran and came to Simon Peter and to the other disciple, whom Jesus loved, and said unto them, “They have taken away the Lord out of the sepulcher, and we know not where they have laid Him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter therefore went forth, and that other disciple, and came to the sepulcher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they both ran together, and the other disciple outran Peter and came first to the sepulcher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And stooping down and looking in, he saw the linen cloths lying, yet he went not in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came Simon Peter following him, and went into the sepulcher and saw the linen cloths as they lay
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the napkin that had been about His head, not lying with the linen cloths, but wrapped together in a place by itself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the other disciple, who came first to the sepulcher, went in also; and he saw, and believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as yet they knew not the Scripture, that He must rise again from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples went away again unto their own home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Mary stood outside at the sepulcher weeping, and as she wept she stooped down and looked into the sepulcher,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saw two angels in white, sitting one at the head and the other at the feet where the body of Jesus had lain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said unto her, “Woman, why weepest thou?” She said unto them, “Because they have taken away my Lord, and I know not where they have laid Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when she had thus said, she turned around and saw Jesus standing, and knew not that it was Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto her, “Woman, why weepest thou? Whom seekest thou?” She, supposing Him to be the gardener, said unto Him, “Sir, if thou have borne Him hence, tell me where thou hast laid Him, and I will take Him away.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto her, “Mary!” She turned herself and said unto Him, “Rabboni!” (which is to say, “Master”).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto her, “Touch Me not, for I am not yet ascended to My Father; but go to My brethren and say unto them, ‘I ascend unto My Father and your Father, and to My God and your God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary Magdalene came and told the disciples that she had seen the Lord, and that He had spoken these things unto her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the same day at evening, being the first day of the week, when the doors were shut where the disciples were assembled for fear of the Jews, came Jesus and stood in their midst and said unto them, “Peace be unto you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when He had so said, He showed unto them His hands and His side. Then were the disciples glad when they saw the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said Jesus to them again, “Peace be unto you. As My Father hath sent Me, even so send I you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when He had said this, He breathed on them and said unto them, “Receive ye the Holy Ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whosoever sins ye remit, they are remitted unto them; and whosoever sins ye retain, they are retained.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Thomas, one of the twelve, called Didymus, was not with them when Jesus came.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The other disciples therefore said unto him, “We have seen the Lord.” But he said unto them, “Unless I shall see in His hands the print of the nails, and put my finger into the print of the nails, and thrust my hand into His side, I will not believe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after eight days the disciples were again within, and Thomas was with them. Then came Jesus, the doors being shut, and stood in their midst and said, “Peace be unto you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said He to Thomas, “Reach hither thy finger and behold My hands, and reach hither thy hand and thrust it into My side: and be not faithless, but believing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Thomas answered and said unto Him, “My Lord and my God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto him, “Thomas, because thou hast seen Me, thou hast believed. Blessed are they that have not seen and yet have believed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many other signs truly did Jesus in the presence of His disciples, which are not written in this book.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But these are written, that ye might believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that believing, ye might have life through His name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things Jesus showed Himself again to the disciples at the Sea of Tiberias, and in this way showed He Himself:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were together Simon Peter, and Thomas called Didymus, and Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, and the sons of Zebedee, and two other of His disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter said unto them, “I am going fishing.” They said unto him, “We also go with thee.” They went forth and entered into a boat immediately; and that night they caught nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the morning had now come, Jesus stood on the shore, but the disciples knew not that it was Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said unto them, “Children, have ye any meat?” And they answered Him, “No.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said unto them, “Cast the net on the right side of the boat, and ye shall find.” They cast therefore, and now they were not able to draw it in for the multitude of fishes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore that disciple whom Jesus loved said unto Peter, “It is the Lord!” Now when Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he girded his fisher’s coat unto him (for he was naked) and cast himself into the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the other disciples came in a little boat (for they were not far from land, but, as it were, two hundred cubits), dragging the net with fishes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon then as they had come to land, they saw a fire of coals there, and fish laid thereon and bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto them, “Bring of the fish which ye have now caught.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter went up and drew the net to land, full of great fishes, a hundred and fifty three; and though there were so many, yet the net was not broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto them, “Come and dine.” And none of the disciples dared ask Him, “Who art Thou?” knowing that it was the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus then came and took bread and gave it to them, and fish likewise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is now the third time that Jesus showed Himself to His disciples after He was risen from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they had dined, Jesus said to Simon Peter, “Simon, son of Jonah, lovest thou Me more than these?” He said unto Him, “Yea, Lord; Thou knowest that I love Thee.” He said unto him, “Feed My lambs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him again the second time, “Simon, son of Jonah, lovest thou Me?” He said unto Him, “Yea, Lord; Thou knowest that I love Thee.” He said unto him, “Feed My sheep.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said unto him the third time, “Simon, son of Jonah, lovest thou Me?” Peter was grieved because He said unto him the third time, “Lovest thou Me?” And he said unto Him, “Lord, Thou knowest all things. Thou knowest that I love Thee.” Jesus said unto him, “Feed My sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Verily, verily I say unto thee, when thou wast young, thou girded thyself and walked whither thou wouldest; but when thou shalt be old, thou shalt stretch forth thy hands, and another shall gird thee and carry thee whither thou wouldest not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This spoke He, signifying by what death he should glorify God. And when He had spoken this, He said unto him, “Follow Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter, turning about, saw the disciple whom Jesus loved following, who also had leaned on His breast at supper, and said, “Lord, who is he that betrayeth Thee?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter, seeing him, said to Jesus, “Lord, and what shall this man do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said unto him, “If I will that he tarry till I come, what is that to thee? Follow thou Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then this saying went abroad among the brethren, that that disciple should not die. Yet Jesus had not said unto him, “He shall not die,” but, “If I will that he tarry till I come, what is that to thee?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the disciple who testifieth of these things and wrote these things, and we know that his testimony is true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there are also many other things which Jesus did, which, if they should be written every one, I suppose that even the world itself could not contain the books that should be written. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
